DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: Pedreira CE;C. E. PEDREIRA;Carlos. E. PEDREIRA;CARLOS PEDREIRA;Pedreira, Carlos E.;Pedreira, Carlos Eduardo;Pedreira, C.E.;Pedreira, C E;Pedreira, Carlos E

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: É bolsista de Produtividade em Pesquisa do CNPq, nível 1B e Cientista-do-Nosso-Estado da FAPERJ. Obteve o grau de Ph.D. em 1987 pelo Imperial College of Science, Technology and Medicine da Universidade de Londres (bolsa CAPES). Engenheiro, graduado pela PUC-Rio, fez mestrado em Eng. Elétrica (Sistemas) na mesma instituição (bolsa CNPq). Ingressou na carreira acadêmica na PUC, tendo deixado esta instituição em 2005. Desde 2006 é professor da UFRJ, atuando na COPPE (Programa de Sistemas e Computação, CAPES 7). Foi professor de Bioestatística na Pós-graduação na Faculdade de Medicina (Programa de Clínica Médica, CAPES 7) entre 2006 e 2016. É pesquisador visitante na Universidade de Salamanca, Espanha desde 2002. Atua como professor e pesquisador em Aprendizagem por Máquina, Classificação de Padrões, Estatística, e em Aplicações na área de saúde. É inventor em diversas patentes no exterior (Estados Unidos, Europa, Austrália e Japão). Tem Índice h = 15 (base ISI), seus artigos têm fator de impacto acumulado > 190 e mais de 1200 citações (base ISI). Orientou (teses concluídas) 16 doutores, 21 mestres, além de vários alunos de pós-doutorado. Como orientador recebeu prêmios da Sociedade Brasileira de Matemática Aplicada e Computacional (alunos de graduação) e da BM&F (finalista em concurso de teses de doutoramento). Seus ex-orientandos atualmente trabalham na BM&FBOVESPA, na Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai em Nova Iorque, no SAS Institute nos E.U., na Universidade de Tsukuba no Japão e em diversas universidades brasileiras. Foi Presidente Fundador da Sociedade Brasileira de Redes Neurais (atual Sociedade Brasileira de Inteligência Computacional). Desde 2016 é 'Statistical Advisor' do periódico Clinical Cytometry. Recebeu o Prêmio Santander de Ciência e Inovação de 2006 (mais de 1000 concorrentes). Foi contemplado, em 2009, com bolsa da Fundação Carolina (Espanha). Vencedor do Prêmio Nicola Albano de 2010 (Sociedade Brasileira de Pediatria).
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Has a research productivity grant from CNPq, level 1B and ?Scientist of our State? distinction from FAPERJ. Obtained the Ph.D. degree in 1987 by the Imperial College of Science, Technology and Medicine at the University of London (CAPES scholarship). Engineer, under-graduated at PUC-Rio, MSc. in Electrical Engineering (systems) in the same institution (CNPq scholarship). Is a visiting researcher at the University of Salamanca, Spain since 2002. Joined the academic career at PUC, having left this institution in 2005. Since 2006, is a Professor at UFRJ, at COPPE (Program of Systems and Computing, Top qualification from CAPES) and at the Faculty of Medicine. Acts as a professor and researcher in Machine Learning, statistics, and healthcare applications. Is inventor on a number of patents abroad (United States, Europe, Australia and Japan). Has H = factor 12 (base ISI), his articles have about 900 citations (ISI base) with accumulated impact factor > 100. Guided (completed theses) 15 doctors, 12 masters and pos-docs. As Students advisor, received awards from the Sociedade Brasileira de Matemática Aplicada e Computacional (undergraduates) and BFM (finalist in competition of doctoral theses). His ex-students today work at the BFM & BOVESPA, the Rockfeler Institute in New York, the SAS Institute in the U.S., the University of Tsukuba in Japan and at various Brazilian universities. He was the Founding President of the Brazilian Neural Networks Society (present-day Brazilian Computational Intelligence Society). Is currently a member of the ' board ' EuroFlow Consortium. Received the ?Santander Prize for Science and Innovation? of 2006 (more than 1000 competitors). Was awarded in 2009, with the ?Carolina Foundation? scholarship (Spain). Is the ?Nicola Albano Award? winner of 2010 (Brazilian society of Paediatrics). Homepage: http://www.cos.ufrj.br/~pedreira. Download articles from: www.researchgate.net/profile/Carlos_Pedreira/publications/?pubType=article&ev=prf_pubs_art

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: EDITORIAL PUBLICADO SOBRE ESTE ARTIGO: Infinite Multidimensionality (DOI: 10.1002/cyto.a.20625) Attila T arnok* IT is no secret that cytometry is the technology to unravel the multifaceted phenotypes of cells and the complexness of cellular systems. The more it is possible to detect a multitude of cellular phenotypes and cellular functions of one cell, the more we become aware of their meaningfulness for understanding aberrations underlying diseases, defining specific therapeutic approaches, as well as the biology of development and senescence. Technologically, the demand for detecting increasingly complex hierarchical networks was satisfied by including more and more detectable colors into a single experimental setup (e.g. 1), realizing the cytometry principles in microscopebased high-content systems (e.g. 2?4) and combining both multiple color measurement with image analysis in flow cytometry instruments (5,6). Very recently, it became evident that the human genetic repertoire is far more versatile and due to substantially more changes as hitherto expected (7?9), even on the level of an individual. These findings now focus the interest on the noncoding ??junk?? regions of the DNA sequence and the spatiotemporal nuclear architecture of the genome. Key steps toward understanding the impact of changes of the nuclear architecture to cell fate are imaging tools for quantification. To this end, Vermolen et al. (10) developed a novel imaging approach for quantifying the 3D interrelationship of several nuclear components in a cell death model of human mesenchymal stem cells. Once these techniques become routine for suspended cells, it is only a relatively minor step for already existing instruments (at least as a game of ideas) to extend these analyses to a high number of eukaryotic cells in suspended cell systems (6). This exploration does not stop at mammalian cells as Calvert et al. (11) show. They now extended in-flow multispectral

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Descreve-se um aparelho analisador para bioquímica sanguínea, controlado por microcomputador, capaz de realizar automaticamente diversos exames bioquímicos. O aparelho compreende uma estrutura de corpo (10) que define uma mesa horizontal (11) e uma parede traseira (12) conjugadas. Sobre a mesa (11) ficam dispostas três bandejas (13, 14, 15) para mistura, soro e reagente, respectivamente, as quais são providas de uma pluralidade de rebaixos (21) dispostos circunferencialmente. Adjacente a cada bandeja está previsto um guindaste respectivo (16, 17, 18) capaz de movimentos de elevação e abaixamento e de movimentos laterais entre as ditas bandejas. Cada um dos guindastes (16, 17, 18) inclui na extremidade terminal ou livre um tubo (32) para aspirar e expelir o líquido transportado.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present invention relates to a method that generates new flow cytometry data files with a potentially infinite number of dimensions, each event contained in these data files having associated information for each of the whole set of parameters evaluated, such information deriving from data which was either directly measured in the flow cytometer or estimated afterwards.

DETALHAMENTO-DA-PATENTE.FINALIDADE: A new method for detecting aberrant phenotypes expressed by neoplastic cells present in bone marrow

REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.TITULO-PATENTE: Eurpean Pattent EP1724581 Method for the multidimensional detection of aberrant phenotypes in neoplastic cells to be used to monitor minimal disease levels using flow cytometry

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A new method for detecting aberrant phenotypes expressed by neoplastic cells present in bone marrow, peripheral blood, spinal fluid and lymph nodes, comprising the steps of: 1) separately staining one or more normal/reactive samples and one neoplastic sample with identical or partially overlapping, multiple combinations of monoclonal antibodies, 2) sequentially measuring the fluorescence emissions associated to large numbers of cells stained with the monoclonal antibodies from the normal/reactive samples and the neoplastic sample, 3) storing two independent list mode data files each containing information on the specific light scatter and fluorescence characteristics of each cell analyzed, 4); creating new data files by mixing list mode data from the data file containing information about the cells present in the neoplastic sample into the data file containing information on the cells present in the normal samples, 5) defining those areas occupied by events corresponding to normal cells and those areas corresponding to empty spaces in normal/reactive samples and that may be occupied by tumor cells in neoplastic samples, 6) sequentially identifying those events corresponding to neoplastic cells and those events corresponding to normal cells coexisting in a multidimensional space, and 7) establishing the most relevant phenotypic aberrations displayed by the neoplastic cells as compared to their normal counterpart.

REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.INSTITUICAO-DEPOSITO-REGISTRO: United States Patent and Trademark Office

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A method that generates new flow cytometry data files with a potentially infinite number of dimensions is described. First two or more separate flow cytometry data files containing information about events measured in different aliquots from the same sample are fused. Then, the magnitude of the values and a corresponding uncertainty measure of the differing variables between one or more of the original data files which have been fused are estimated, for each individual event contained in the fused data file, for which that variable was not directly measured in the flow cytometer. The new data file containing both data actually measured in the flow cytometer for each event of the individual original data files fused and the estimated data for those parameters not measured in a group of events from one or more of the original data files are reconstructed multidimensionally.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The invention relates to a novel method for the detection of aberrant phenotypes expressed by neoplastic cells present in bone marrow, blood, cerebrospinal fluid and lymph node samples. The invention comprises a series of steps, in which the method simulates experiments involving the dilution of neoplastic cells in a normal sample with the use of computational procedures, and could be used by mixing the information either directly from two or more different data files or after adjusting the relative position of the cell populations in accordance with pre-defined standards.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: (EN)The invention relates to the field of flow cytometry and more particularly to a panel of antibody reagents conjugated to fluorescent compounds. Provided are reagent compositions, comprising at least eight distinct fluorochrome-conjugated antibodies comprising a set of at least three identification antibodies for the identification of a leukocyte population of interest and at least four characterization antibodies for further characterization and/or classification of said leukocyte population. Also provided are kits and methods related to the reagent compositions. (FR)Cette invention concerne le domaine de la cytométrie en flux et plus particulièrement, un ensemble représentatif de réactifs de type anticorps conjugués à des composés fluorescents. Des compositions de réactifs comprenant au moins huit anticorps distincts conjugués à des fluorochromes dont un lot d'au moins trois anticorps d'identification pour l'identification d'une population leucocytaire d'intérêt et au moins quatre anticorps de caractérisation pour la caractérisation supplémentaire et/ou la classification de ladite population leucocytaire sont décrites. Des kits et des procédés concernant lesdites compositions de réactifs sont également décrits.

Also provided are kits and methods related to the reagent compositions.
